Description: German ambassador in Paris since August 1940.
Sources 1: Das Personenlexikon zum Dritten Reich / E. Klee. - Frankfurt am Main : S. Fischer, 2003. - p. 9.
Sources 2: Biographisches Lexikon zum Dritten Reich / H. Weiß. - Frankfurt am Main : Fischer Taschenbuch Verlag, 1998. - p. 15

Description: Judenberater of Eichmann. SS-Hauptsturmführer in the Reichssicherheitshauptamt.
Sources 1: Das Personenlexikon zum Dritten Reich / E. Klee. - Frankfurt am Main : S. Fischer, 2003. - p. 9

Name variations First name: H.G. ; Hans Günther ; Hans Günter ; Hans-Günther
Description: German language writer, survivor or Terezin.
Romanian jurist and Gouverneur of Transnistria 1941-1944, 1946 as war criminal sentenced to death.

T4. NSDAP/SA. Jurist, Oberregierungsrat (1943), SA-Sturmbannführer (1944). Since Jan 1941 manager (Geschäftsführer) of the "Euthanasia" Center T4. Spring 1944 appointed head of Aktion Reinhard in Trieste, responsible for combatting partisans and Jews. 20.12.1968 sentenced to 8 years of imprisonment by LG Frankfurt a.M. for complicity to murder of at least 34 549 people.
Sources 1: Das Personenlexikon zum Dritten Reich / E. Klee. - Frankfurt am Main : S. Fischer, 2003. - p. 12
The YIVO encyclopedia of Jews in Eastern Europe / ed. G. D. Hundert. - Yale Univ., 2008. - p. 582-84.

Description: Jewish socialist activist and publicist of the BUND, arrested by NKVD and in July 1941 sentenced to death twice and executed in 1941 or 1943 for "spying for Hitler".
Sources 1: Encyclopaedia Judaica / ed. F. Skolnik and M. Berenbaum. - Macmillan, 2007. - Vol. 2, p. 18.

Description: Commanding officer of the Polish army in the Middle East and Italy during World War II who became a leading figure among the anticommunist Poles who refused to return to their homeland after the war.
